2C46F6A261AC481C8E8E90FC3C5B7C65.description: Draw a diagram of a modern landfill and label the various components that are required or used in landfills today to prevent them from polluting the air and water.

D6EDB99DDE8A4980A972D7C99D178FCD.description: Describe the benefits and challenges of recycling.

D9A94F04E54940CDBBE886A60C7E3104.description: Document the amount of waste a family/individual produces throughout a 24-hour period. Identify the materials that are non-recyclable and recyclable.

20523AD160414FB1A0B8BBF10951483A.description: Plan and implement an investigation to explore human health issues related to the disposal of hazardous waste materials (e.g., biomagnification or bioaccumulation within a specific Ohio ecosystem). Existing public case studies can be used, such as a local Brownfields case.

8FFD3FAC6D0A4963A6FBCA9968DCEE3D.description: Research the waste management issues and the root causes for the problems that face the local community, Ohio, the United States or the world.

C9E8DA627F8145F09CE119DD639B35EC.description: Collect research information on various waste management types. Compare and contrast the practices of waste management of developed and developing nations. Compare methods of at least two different nations and identify the best practices.

AF14B9A0B01741108689B96C085EE6C0.description: Conduct a landfill decomposition study over an extended period to determine the rate at which typical materials found in landfills decompose.

F1F360042FC94FC6B21B5A0585274414.description: Construct and maintain a composting site on school grounds.

C8C3A0817FA04DC5AEF452C2B942FE61.description: Research composting techniques. Analyze the wastes produced by the school and design an appropriate composting system to process the biodegradable waste produced.

3D03FF06EDF749A188211C0BDD46AFD6.description: Develop a risk assessment for humans or the environment due to a toxin or hazardous chemical used by a company. The assessment should include: nature of the toxin/chemical, on-site use and handling (including existing safety practices), by-products (e.g., vapors, dilution processes), storage, transportation and emergency plans. Consider the topography and geology of the area and how these contribute to the flow of spills or leaks. Use a computer-modeling program (many are available through freeware sites) to model and predict the movement and possible pathways of the toxin/chemical. Make recommendations for containment methods.

60ECC6E94E824BA381729B01AEEA2AF9.description: Identify areas where urban sprawl has impacted plant, wildlife and human communities. Describe the effects on biodiversity.

C6B47CD7A78B48D2A7DF12B1F3633F39.description: Complete a graphic organizer on various tree harvesting practices (e.g., clear cutting, seed tree cutting, selective cutting, slash & burn) including a description of economic and ecological advantages and disadvantages of each.

9FBF08C1231E4454BB6161B2D2B536E2.description: Engage in a classroom discussion on the rationale and methods to reduce the deer population in an Ohio community.

0D0D29FE5DF14F8182A76ED5D751D4E9.description: Develop a PSA on commercial products that contribute to deforestation (e.g., palm oil) and how deforestation contributes to the loss of biodiversity.

81E449144E034A67A39C424E33AEA55C.description: Write a proposal for the state setting limits/regulations for housing/commercial development through the lens of biodiversity. Consider federal laws.

AF370DD05FC148B49BCFCEB73970C173.description: Use satellite mapping resources (NASA Forest Changes in Rondonia, Brazil) to investigate the connection between urbanization, population growth and deforestation. Summarize your findings.

43351FC40E0B42E8A553B042DB018865.description: Design a community of the future that demonstrates responsible practices for preservation of biodiversity and forested areas.

6C26A8EA19A049C9B2CDB189858EE8E7.description: Using the National Geographic Website, What the World Eats, explore and compare the pie graphs to determine which country consumes the most/least daily calories, the most/least grains, the most/least meat, etc.

040B7F29E2304AC79D7B57D89FA64D4B.description: Construct an energy pyramid (with a human at the top) and use data to defend or oppose the position that eating lower on the food chain is better for the environment.

4B0AF9921ACC47CE94D589EC3D96B260.description: Research Genetically Modified Organisms used in agriculture and discuss advantages and disadvantages.

0FC9C619F1954A51ADBEABDCD05974D6.description: Research food production in developing and underdeveloped nations, comparing land use vs. crop yield. Present your findings.

3EBC9D72560F4C91B2C5E6CA6C39C993.description: Design and conduct an investigation to determine if a fertilizer or pesticide is toxic to an organism (e.g., radish seeds).

9727ACBAF8C146D4B45F9A074AA5534C.description: Construct a plan for a sustainable garden that could provide food for your school/community. Share your plan with stakeholders.

9B0BEE1F26D44E44A941E622F922E9DD.description: Identify the locations of food deserts in your community or surrounding areas. Write a proposal to the local government to provide that community with better food resources.

F470015FECCD45878482B2B5E5C2B235.description: Identify indoor pollutants and their sources. Explain their impacts.

C5AC4000D6DB4DAD910F49A9FC3D1F7A.description: Illustrate the process of how acid rain is created and describe its effects on each component of the environment.

DC9591E400624CB2BA8A25ACB41F30FD.description: Using real-time data, research air pollution issues (and the root causes for the problems) that face the local community, Ohio, the United States or the world. Present evidence (quantitative data) and conclusions orally, through a poster session or in written form (scientific research paper).

72E051DAFE904130B58723810380BC94.description: Use a case study for a city that has historically experienced air pollution (e.g., Beijing, Detroit). Analyze the situation and identify issues/actions described in the case which may be problematic.

B8401E5FC0094538A18963F46E0D67B5.description: Conduct an investigation comparing the concentration of tropospheric ozone in various locations in the community and analyze the results to determine the cause(s) for the any differences in concentrations.

1F563E7DF1C842E4AE1FBF037D01C01D.description: Investigate the effects of acid rain (with a range of pH) on seed sprouting.

0A1BA7808A564D0B8BAD82E588DA5FB3.description: Identify a problem or issue with air quality in your school/community. Use real data from the EPA and develop a solution.

F577A18AAC9E4BA785E4E72B6770F26D.description: Design and construct a scrubber for cleaning the sulfur emissions from burning coal. Assess how well the scrubber works by collecting calcium sulfate or sulfite to compare against a control.

36EAD1D799994DCEBC1B589C19B346C4.description: Research the requirements for listing a species as a species of concern, threatened or endangered on the state or federal level. Identify a species on one of these lists and research its life history, specifically the impacts leading to its decline.

DE9638BF98224EF7BC5A75207DAEF9C3.description: The National Audubon Society has been collecting data on avian population and movements for over a century through the annual Christmas Bird Count. Download a dataset of the history of birds for your locality and investigate trends in the status of populations.

DEEE62B22DA84F90947240D135D6F202.description: Create an infographic on an endangered species, including information on the organism's ecosystem and its role within the ecosystem, its value (ecologically and commercially), reasons for endangerment and possible solutions or interventions.

FBD6FDDAAF4245618A3624795538D2CD.description: Research the effect that climate change is having or has had on a specific living or extinct species (e.g., harp seal, polar bear, dinosaur, elkhorn coral) or on an ecosystem (e.g., the Great Barrier Reef, the Arctic Circle).

2B8811D7800844CDA4053E4334E106C5.description: Using phenological protocols, collect information on the local plants and wildlife as the seasons progress and contribute data to a local or global study. Track for comparison from year to year and location to location. Identify trends in phenological changes and design solutions to local climate impacts.

7FE9AC4D497C40CF89004310A9517E4A.description: Analyze a conservation case study (e.g., osprey, bald eagle, black bears in Ohio) and write an analysis and a recommendation for solutions.

7E57648A0D5B4A44A4C5CEFA6942B658.description: Use the Tragedy of the Commons simulation activity to identify and explain potential strategies to prevent the destruction of a common resource.

A9E3728258CF46EF9444434B6F19E95C.description: Use an online ecological footprint calculator (e.g., Earth Day Network) to compare how many Earths it would take to sustain the world population for various lifestyles.

7A29DDC24E054CB7872D11F11B37FEFC.description: Create a pie chart displaying the breakdown of components of an individual's ecological footprint (e.g., shelter, food, energy, transportation), and construct a plan to reduce his/her carbon footprint.

718D17D75EF54145910C8DA282F72F74.description: Research and design a sustainable lifestyle in regard to energy efficient living space and mindfully using resources, alternative transportation, dietary sources and outdoor space.

BAE83AB573A547F9895C88E8D9B042DE.description: Redesign a city/village/town to be more sustainable. Examine concepts such as waste treatment, water resources, pollution, transportation, energy resources and maintaining biodiversity. Share recommendations and incorporate feedback to make a final proposal for the city/village/town.

62171E145DAD41C09A00495FE624F467.description: Explain the correlation between historical carbon dioxide concentration data and historical global temperature data.

4DDCF9EF558742AEA7DE4CAE2B466441.description: Develop position papers for and against increasing federal spending on climate change research.

636810BF4C8D477F9296BB66F8A8E44E.description: Investigate the history of local habitats experiencing change (e.g., the Great Lakes).

DAA52DBA49C64DA2BCEFCC8B515327FB.description: Create a timeline of climate science and policy initiatives over the past two centuries in developing and non-developing countries. Include global data and compare different nations.

A0BFCD49C2224665BB473DD79ABC424B.description: Compare the effects of El Niño and La Niña at two different longitudinal locations, but at the same latitude, using sea surface temperature and precipitation from real satellite data.

01F894164FA84A75BA639664E6FD2132.description: Research monthly average precipitation data in different areas to strengthen conclusions about periods of drought or abnormal rainfall as they relate to climate change.

9036ED50F6B44548BDE75C6DF63287CC.description: Analyze geoscience data and the results from global climate models to make an evidence-based forecast of the current rate of global or regional climate change and associated future impacts to Earth systems.

10C7DE61C824400B931E7BC456017E19.description: Choose a specific location in the United States. Research and analyze the patterns of climate change throughout the geologic record, human historical data and present-day data for the location. Be able to explain the interpretation and analysis of the data.

C447AF5E8CA3461A831C3E0E6A3A6C5E.description: Define potable water. Identify the locations of large sources of freshwater in the world and use this to explain why certain populations have little access to clean water.

1087E2688E2A4AAC934C5A5CD6C1999B.description: Conduct a water survey in your home/school. How much water do you use on a daily basis and how much does it cost? Identify areas where water can be saved.

053D893C2FB24E1B9100275671247222.description: Investigate sources of drinking water pollutants and design a plan to lower, restrict or prevent those pollutants.

5469A0B6937949AB87B3F4C935648802.description: Examine the water quality report from a municipality to determine the health of the water. Investigate the effects of disinfection byproducts (DBPs) which result when chlorine and other disinfectants breakdown over time.

859F2CB47B2248138F3370A77924E8C3.description: Investigate the source of various bottled water. Some brands come from municipal water supplies. Record each water source on a map.

4183E040286B4CBF806A0C0C3A09EE80.description: Test a local water source for contaminants and compare findings to the released water quality reports. If discrepancies exist, predict possible causes.

78602760C6184B6F84EE05DA509073CC.description: Using data, research a severe water related environmental problem (and its root causes) that faces the local community, Ohio, the United States or the world. Propose ways to mitigate the problem.

B9AB7AEB0FBB44668F044D27CC16657E.description: Design and build an irrigation system that will move water at a specific rate.

1B27E70512564CD7A8F7E8FD61B95737.description: Design a water treatment system or process that can be implemented at a low cost and without the need for electricity to be used in areas that do not have access to potable water.

2D905B3C479D4B059A2388F686D513A0.description: Potable water quality, use, and availability

9DC6B53E9B464F61BFA36BBDE5AAD877.description: Compare developing and developed countries, identifying the factors that separate the two types of countries.

2C2BDCB179504CFBBCA94583B14B0260.description: Relative to resource availability and rates of consumption, assess the scope of human population growth and potential limits to its growth (e.g., Tragedy of the Commons, Hans Rosling and Gapminder Foundation)

0AF4804C8F6C4BDC8216AA9436CE8694.description: Compare local fertility rates to national and international rates. Consider environmental and societal factors contributing to differences.

3759243846B34367B634C4C9CF1FF567.description: Interpret population demographic curves, graphs or pyramids (e.g., from US Census Bureau, the UN Census, World Fact Book) and discuss differences in population growth rates among several different countries (developing vs. developed).

FBAC3D621D4949AEB027BF83E49B56F8.description: Use data on birth rates, death rates, life expectancy, average income and literacy rates of various countries1 to develop a plan that could contribute to a change in the fertility and death rates.

7E113634553C45D9ADEE6CE738791969.description: Plan and implement a population study of a specific area over a period of time or critique/analyze an existing population study. Document changes in weather, food availability and any change to the population. Prepare a scientific analysis and conclusion (in writing) for the study.

F1A761A363B3487A8750E8BBD0A2D0E0.description: Work in design teams to create a plan to develop a parcel of undeveloped rural land or to revitalize an urban neighborhood that has been blighted. Solutions must address housing, transportation, business and industrial, green space and recreational land uses as well as food, water, waste and energy systems. An extension could limit funds available.

E1CBE8C8A8214880B9D56D693D6FAB9D.description: Identify invasive species in the community and describe their impacts on the local food web.

7C434CDB974E4DA1ADD867653B4D08C0.description: Create a presentation for local stakeholders on the hazards of invasive species.

242D8E3CAF62458F9CE56EFED910DB7E.description: Discuss the process of biomagnification and the ramifications if a primary consumer or a producer is removed or too many consumers or producers are introduced.

ED3F8AC382F74D31AAF442324DB54C5E.description: Research an Ohio wilderness or water ecosystem. Identify threats to each species, including human impacts.

5898B2AED5C94E259B89C86DC859A8F7.description: Compare the biodiversity of two natural areas, including richness and distribution. Draw conclusions, including how the biodiversity is relevant toward mitigating the impact of invasive species.

F33550F1EC434C619B47321C5D77AFCD.description: Write a bill to be presented to state policy makers restricting, preventing or eliminating an invasive species in Ohio.

50AC6EEE11974881A6A4A9A8EA2BCB65.description: Choose a specific living species. Using scientific data, trace the history of that species. Show existing, established evolutionary relationships, environmental (both biotic and abiotic) requirements, global locations, ecosystem characteristics and sustainability predictions. Use quantifiable data to support findings.

70D9A080EA894DCF8F553B15B2499A85.description: Design a plan to preserve/conserve a wilderness or waterway in Ohio. Be specific and defend your rationale with data. Include biological and ecological relationships within the system.

C528B058CF37400BA2808CBCEE618F8B.description: Make assessments about the introduction of species. Identify ways that it boosts endangered species populations and potential negative impacts.

C09007C417CE483A9061BAC5617C6CC9.description: Evaluate current practices to conserve or recover native species that are currently endangered.

BF85890BA55A42558CAD06F8D26090E3.description: Identify at least two examples of modern desertification. Choose one in the United States and one in another country.

3F322680AB474B24B9187694E5EA9CB4.description: Deconstruct an area affected by a mass wasting, desertification or erosion event and write a detailed explanation with data. Write a "brief" for a law firm assigning responsibility for purposes of restitution and remediation.

8C6C44D9F0F74C57A81F37AC5C7C54E1.description: Write a letter to a company which historically violated EPA laws outlining their violations and the impact on the environment.

E4F86ADE388E4E87A99C4582683AD936.description: Research current FDA laws pertaining to food safety for agriculture and write user-friendly versions of the laws for the public to access on the FDA website.

93C82430D6954AC8AD138CC68609FCEA.description: Conduct soil tests on various sites around the school or community. Determine an appropriate location for planting a community garden. Consider soil types, precipitation and yield.

9650F3EC3DBA441B803D12509DE2A5A8.description: Create a plan to revitalize a brownfield site in one of the Great Lake States. Be sure to include an explanation of how it became a brownfield.

F9C3B9065B4648EC813B5FDC485876D5.description: Read the Clean Water Act and propose an amendment to address increases in populations and changes to ecosystems.

C0F872D27FCC4B5EB3D65A8467020257.description: Research water as a resource. Identify areas of concern and classify various sources (e.g., fresh, salt, ground, surface, glacier).

38AEC1D6CCF34EA6A9CC75D1496B0B2B.description: Read excerpts or summaries of Rachel Carson's Silent Spring and create scenarios which model the effects of toxins introduced into a water system. Examine the actions that resulted from the publication of this book.

61CDDE9288564F66B4C79E41016BE2BB.description: Perform a water assessment on your home or school. Outline a water conservation plan based on the assessment. Explain where water can be conserved. Model how small changes can have large effects.

7F5702058E0D4DEA8CEB76CF2DB7F3EC.description: Examine and report on your town's or city's water delivery system. Include where your drinking water comes from and where your waste water goes.

2C8A99F38FCF49CBB1B0A6BD3A8CD608.description: Identify two waterways in your area, one in a developed area and another in a natural area. Use biotic indicators and chemical tests to determine if any differences exist. Explain your findings, including ways contaminants may have moved from area to area.

77E60B1402C948878FD7C415F40C6F71.description: Conduct a water quality field test of various local bodies of water, and determine how the results (e.g., dissolved oxygen content, phosphates, nitrates/nitrites, pH, fecal coliform) could impact aquatic ecosystems.

4F280D8474A044738B4EA88DF8F951A8.description: Design and build a water filter with commonly available materials for either wastewater or drinking water, taking into account cost and efficiency. Test the water filter, analyze the data collected and brainstorm ideas on how to improve the design.

9945C65C9B0941579FE9504C44DF640A.description: Read the Clean Air Act and create a timeline demonstrating major events that led up to it and major events which occurred after it. Include results of those events.

8F85346B3F88484DA46CD7B54EBB929F.description: Design and create a poster/graphic organizer/infographic illustrating the difference between primary and secondary contaminants.

1F7BD6718F0847D592DF1A63EEE767E5.description: Create a presentation on the major types and sources of air pollution. Compare the main types and illustrate ways to prevent air pollution.

F541A1795C144AC09D4161DA7A77058F.description: Using the Clean Air Act as an example, propose an updated policy for the next 20 years, being sure to consider technology and demographics.

13327E05396E41328ECF1F4BF9A72973.description: Using ice core models and/or datasets, make a graph showing how elements in the atmosphere can change over time. Interpret and extrapolate into the future.

4149606C4136443FB087296F565DB728.description: Looking at air quality data (e.g., from the US EPA) outline a plan for Ohio or the Great Lake States to improve air in the next seven years.

F20F4CAB6DCB42AA8B47671BADCB19AD.description: Construct a model of your home or school explaining the internal air pollutants. Determine the relationships between the pollutants and human activities in or near your home/school.

30566F29C3314465AE24EF94212F2232.description: Conduct tests for air quality in and around your school, investigate the sources of any pollutants and design a plan to remove or reduce the pollutants.

836A121EF6824379B7C8E93B6A914CAC.description: Design a "city makeover" for a city near you. Your new city must promote clean air practices. Consider mass transit, industry, infrastructure, homes, education and technology.

24FBBD75B08C4C4882B2246FBABB9058.description: Research a widely used energy source (e.g., nuclear, oil, gas, wind, solar) and create a detailed poster discussing the pros and cons of its use.

57FD5CB3185C48879166CDC13BBE1C66.description: Identify the primary resources used in your community for energy. Create a brochure explaining and comparing the sources.

4721E5D4514D43F7B9940908E8CBABDB.description: Create a public service announcement explaining the importance of energy conservation in your community, home and school. Include methods for conservation.

CCF13420DC76492F86AEBDA06B85EE90.description: Compare energy usage of the United States to energy usage of a developing nation. Parse it down to a "typical" family in America and a "typical" family in the developing country.

9F5EA1B562904FF38BDCF5B250E1552C.description: Compose a letter to a local politician or school board outlining the need for renewable/alternative energy exploration and incorporation into your city. Include information about taxes, resources and infrastructure.

D197B92420FA45B7B0D2E44B6E6AD4AF.description: Record energy usage in your home for a 24 to 48-hour period. With parental permission, review an electric bill for your home and identify adoptable strategies to reduce your home's energy usage.

A7DE4585805247C4A1D1F2FCBA3EC666.description: Contact your local energy provider and conduct an energy audit of your school. Identify areas where energy can be conserved. Generate a plan to decrease energy footprint.

86809683665147E9A85D2A7F00986F5B.description: Using existing energy technologies (e.g., tidal power plants, solar panels, scrubbers) as an example, generate an alternative way to collect energy or improve an existing energy technology. Test your design.

A538AD3A769A4B9EB978AE71F7F7CF03.description: Design an energy efficient, clean, renewable community based upon real data and models of other cities or communities. Include explanations of the benefits and consequences of various aspects of the city design.

3C541797FBA146EF970FEB102F419C2E.description: Write an article explaining the difference between climate and weather and the importance of distinguishing between the two.

9C0003722509457F9A280019DE077CDA.description: Explore, analyze and interpret past and current climate patterns for 10 different cities around the world. Analyze differences between climate patterns. Make predictions of future patterns.

DE3FE52F59CB49F191765A7584D59A24.description: Describe the relationship between ocean surface temperature and hurricane intensity, using the NOAA database. Create a map of the most vulnerable areas and use it to identify highly populated areas that could be affected.

27B0C82FB7E44F088FEADF9FB188F2EA.description: Research an actual environmental or geologic event (e.g., release of a toxin/contaminant, hurricane, earthquake, volcano, flood, fire, landslide) and determine how each of Earth's spheres was impacted. Include long-term and short-term impacts. Trace the movement of contamination or energy through each sphere. Provide scientific evidence and data to support conclusions.

177199808CEF4192BBCE9E91D540CF15.description: Model and describe how toxins enter and accumulate in a food chain. Find and paraphrase laws/regulations which attempt to regulate use of potential contaminants (e.g., DDT, BPA, pharmaceuticals, lead).

3534F55793054A05B6C7ECC83E724F08.description: Research, design, create and maintain a tabletop sustainable biosphere (e.g., eco column) using aquarium gravel, live aquatic plants and aquatic organisms (e.g., fish, ghost shrimp, Sea Monkeys ®). Use it to study nutrient cycling, limiting factors, decomposition, water quality and eutrophication.

0281B6492406499FAE573FD2EDB558F8.description: Use quantifiable data and evidence to investigate the relationship between deforestation and changing weather or, in some cases, climate, at a specific location (e.g., the Amazon region of South America). Analyze the data and draw a conclusion based upon the analysis.

2FBA62E547B344A386CF6CA418A52F79.description: Movement of matter and energy through the hydrosphere, lithosphere, atmosphere and biosphere

7C42B242695E4375B9D6855AE2546F93.description: Use a regional map to identify local water sources and their proximity to schools, neighborhoods and shopping centers. Indicate how those developments may infringe upon the health of the water sources.

75C42ED98A424C59AAD21DDA781FE1C6.description: Use Ohio EPA well water data to compare water composition of a contaminated site with groundwater from your own community.

FA009DC3320E4241B0D26EFD9B9EC933.description: Research a water resource disaster and describe various ways the disaster has altered the ecosystem of the region. Explain the stability of that ecosystem, as well as how it has changed over time.

DFE73A50D3F745FB8CA21768C578F39E.description: Plan a demonstration to illustrate the factors that lead to changing oceanic currents (both deep and shallow).

58795AB941DF449DAA27C96F2D7D991F.description: Create a map of the local watershed including boundaries of adjoining watersheds. Have the map depict movement and direction of water within the watershed.

F9D546F3F57C4257931E9C52F7000C68.description: Design methods to transport potable water to arid areas. Consider availability of materials, cost and efficiency.

8A40A8E80D644836BB9399BE7A656106.description: Investigate various methods to clean up an oil spill using a model to evaluate their effectiveness. At the completion of the clean-up process, each team will assess the effectiveness, including environmental impact of the cleanup process, and make suggestions for improvement.

186DCDD236EE4308AECB2B0BE205501F.description: Construct a functioning shower using only four gallons of water and household materials, which would allow someone to wash the body and hair effectively and capture the gray water produced. The shower construction should be tested to assure it meets design criteria and that it will adequately allow for a person to wash.

F17A7FF85F264C3CAB8577CCFF698230.description: Build a model of the layers of the Earth in order to identify and describe the components and their role in geologic events.

1403314716A148B796B2966753193446.description: Compare soils found in various parts of the community. Use information gathered to create a soil texture map of the community.

62A180AFC33E42C0BC4E2C466FA1A27B.description: Find a large tract of property for sale in your community. Using knowledge of the lithosphere through data found on United States Department of Agriculture's site, make recommendations on how this property could be used in the future.

2A1B48616EC74868AA0D8C2FD9CB4A16.description: Examine human impacts on the lithosphere (e.g., hydraulic fracturing, surface mining, urbanization) and hypothesize possible consequences.

1C047980E62D480A9499177E7B9DDDC8.description: Research and analyze an event (e.g., naturally caused [an Icelandic volcano] or anthropogenically caused [oil spills]) and make a model to demonstrate how the different spheres (e.g., atmosphere, biosphere, lithosphere, hydrosphere) are impacted.

169B89CC4D6143589BFAAF01661F8FD7.description: Complete a foldable or other manipulative on the layers of the Earth's atmosphere, complete with description and chemical composition.

414B4A2148FD4C43A7DFE59A5B074A2B.description: Explain the effects and causes of El Niño/La Niña weather patterns on Earth's spheres, biogeochemical cycles and biodiversity. Include regional comparisons of the effects of these events.

99F1055500BA48339AF696FA53D4AFA3.description: Determine the carrying capacity of an ecosystem using historical or current data (e.g., Moose on Isle Royale, Kaibab Deer in Arizona).

F1D613EE34AF4C5495DC39367E6220C0.description: Evaluate current protection and management laws pertaining to endangered species and their habitats.

1A0170A4DD424D8D96AB9405465FA369.description: Graph survivorship curves to make judgements about environmental and health conditions in various habitats/ecosystems.

AEC3E1B5C713494E98B09B41043B3957.description: Conduct a pond study, calculate biodiversity index and construct a sustainable food web. Research how biomagnification or bioaccumulation impacts specific Ohio ecosystems. Research should include the possible impact to humans. Present research and findings on biomagnification and bioaccumulation impacts on specific Ohio ecosystems (e.g., using "Ohio's Sportfish Consumption Advisory" published annually by the Ohio EPA).

B6E5C8C2D18743EAABB289E3918F43BD.description: Choose two accessible habitats and take a field trip. Choose a level and type of taxa (e.g., birds, insects, spiders, trees, herbaceous plants). Collect data on species diversity and abundance. Compare and contrast data using Simpson's Diversity Index or Shannon-Weiner Index to measure species diversity/abundance and compare the relative health of the two habitats.

E982E76799794627A573E82A5DC1AB30.description: Plan and implement a population study of a specific area over a period of time or critique/analyze an existing population study. Document changes in weather, food availability and any change to the population. Prepare a scientific analysis and conclusion for the study.

C272971B4EE04FF8BF11BB98816314ED.description: Research an endangered species and develop a conservation plan for the species taking into account the interests of all stakeholders. List the advantages and disadvantages of conservation.

BABAC9B4CA614F26AAD7ADE74FFD7AC1.description: Taking economics, government regulations and current technology into consideration, design a new method to reclaim a former brownfield in the Great Lakes Region.

49441573EE3B4E7E9B79A02F46853C06.description: Evaluate and critique current trends in reclaiming former industrial sites.

AFE2A9E209B04DA6A49360BFE579A6A5.description: Identify an instance of biomagnification or bioaccumulation within a specific ecosystem and propose possible solutions.
